Fields.DialogueText: I know you're in pain, but know that you are fighting for your nation. One day, you will be able to return home, have children, and tell them that you helped bring peace to your country!
Garibaldi?
Oh! Hello, Capitano.

Fields.MenuText: What are you doing down here in the sick bay?
How is he holding up?
Are you pestering my crew?

Fields.DialogueText: Making sure everyone's staying in good spirits, of course!
He's doing better. Hopefully he'll be back on his feet soon...
I hope not!
After the last battle, I thought I would come down here and raise some of the injured crew members' morale.
There's more to victory than just surviving a battle, after all. You have to make sure that your crew knows what they're fighting for.
And did I hear someone humming?
Oh! That was me! Bersaglieri's Fanfare, my favorite song. Whenever I find myself upset, I hum the melody to help soothe my worries.
I figured the crew would like to hear something besides the pounding of weaponry.
It is nice to hear something different for a ch--
*ALARM*
Let's get to the bridge!
Yes, Capitano!
@BATTLE
There are Morganas within our range! Ready the guns!
Aye, Capitano!
On my order...
@BATTLE
*murmurs*
I know, I know, that was a difficult battle. But right now, I need a status repo...
Great work everyone! Your perseverance made this victory possible!
Re... really? Thank you, ma'am.
No, thank YOU! I have no doubt that the Morganas are starting to realize that they have no chance of winning against us!
Now, let's see how the ship is faring. And after that, let's celebrate this win! We're one step closer to peace!
*APPLAUSE*
Yes, ma'am!

Fields.MenuText: You sure know how to boost morale!
I'd appreciate it if you wouldn't cut me off, Garibaldi.
We can celebrate later. We still have work to do.

Fields.DialogueText: It's an important skill to have!
I apologize, Capitano. Sometimes I get caught up in the moment...
But make sure we do celebrate at some point! It's good to let off steam once in awhile!
All right, all right. Good work out there, Garibaldi.
Grazie, Capitano!
Is that... an orange?
Umm... can I help you, Garibaldi? That's an awfully intense look you have on your face...
Mmm... mhmm...

Fields.MenuText: What's the matter?
Pestering my crew again?
It's impolite to stare, Garibaldi.

Fields.DialogueText: We have oranges?
I'm just having difficulty tearing my eyes away from that fruit...
It's impolite to not offer a woman an orange slice.
Y... you can have some if you'd like...
What a gentleman! I'd love to share this meal with you! We can talk about our political beliefs while eat.
You know, the galley has oranges...
Oh! I almost forgot! Would you like to join in, Capitano?
Some other time...
@BATTLE
Sailor! I heard that you enjoy reading?
Yes. Whenever we're not in battle, I read to relax myself for a while.
I do too! What are you reading right now?
The Grapes Of Wrath.
I think I've heard about that one. It's about folks looking for a better way of life, right?
In a manner of speaking, yes.
You know, we aren't so different from the characters in that book.
How so?
We're fighting for a better life amongst all of this uncertainty. It's people like us that can help unify the world, regardless of ideals. Here... I made this for you!
A candle?
I figured it gets hard to read at night, so I make these for the crew members!
Thank you, ma'am.
*ALARM*
Now let's show our enemy how determined we are to bring prosperity to the world!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: That was thoughtful of you.
Maybe they need more sleep instead of staying up reading at night.
Do you really have time for all that?

Fields.DialogueText: The crew is always the first thing I think about, Capitano.
I do my best to make time.
Sometimes reading can help people fall asleep, Capitano.
We are under attack! This is not a drill, we have to MOVE! NOW!
@BATTLE
Garibaldi? I see you're humming in the sick bay again.
Garibaldi?
... He didn't make it.
Who didn't make it?
One of the crew members. I don't know how but... he passed. And I was so sure he was going to survive...

Fields.MenuText: This is war, unfortunately. Not everyone makes it out alive.
He died with honor.
If we mourn every loss, then we'll lose our resolve to keep fighting.

Fields.DialogueText: I know... I just wish he could have returned home after all of this was over...
We must ensure that he is remembered.
And if we ignore our casualties, we'll become just as ruthless as the Morganas.
I told him that he could live out the rest of his life in peace after the war... that he was a hero.
But I know that, in some way or another... he is at peace. After all, he gave his life for this great cause.
That's very kind of you, Garibaldi. You have a way with words.
Thank you, Capitano. I suppose I'd best get back to work. I can't have his death be in vain, after all.
Of course.
There she is again. We will get our revenge. Crew, Prepare for battle!
@BATTLE
Hello, Capitano! We did such a good job in the last fight that I thought we should take a break. Would you like to join me for coffee and orange slices?
I could use a break. Thank you, Garibaldi.
The coffee isn't as good as the cappuccinos at Caffè San Marco, but it'll do.
Caffè San Marco? I've never heard of it.
It's a beautiful establishment in Trieste, a quiet city in northeastern Italy. I dream of going myself, one day, and chatting with the locals for hours about politics.

Fields.MenuText: I've never been. Tell me some more about Italy.
You do like discussing politics, don't you?
You think you'll actually be able to go, some day?

Fields.DialogueText: It's beautiful! The architecture, the weather, the landmarks. You can't go a minute without feeling as if you're in a painting.
Of course I do! It's good to understand your own beliefs, and the beliefs of others. Especially in times like these.
I'd like to think so. I've spent so much time fighting for country, I love to experience it myself.
I do worry though, about my home. I fear that, when this fight against the Morganas is over, I'll still have to fight to keep my homeland from succumbing to the Fascist party.
The fate of Italy is uncertain, and it becomes more uncertain every day.
I think everyone here is worried about their homeland.
And yet... they still fight. It's poetic, to put your life on the line for what you believe in. But it's equally as tragic.
Some won't be able to see the results of their hard work. I hope the sacrifices we make aren't in vain.
You're a regular champion of the people, Garibaldi.
I try, Capitano. Anyway, thank you for sharing your break with me. It brought back many good memories.
*APPLAUSE*
Go!
Garibaldi, what's the meaning of this?
Hi, Capitano! Everyone seemed a little out of spirits, so I thought I'd liven up the room a bit!
With arm wrestling? And what's that you're holding?
It's the prize for winning! I love to make things out of wood, so I thought I'd make a trophy for this competition!
*SLAM*
Yes! I won!
What an exciting match! Let's all give them a round of applause!
*APPLAUSE*
I suppose that's the end of our fun, unless... the Capitano wants to join!
*CHEERS*

Fields.MenuText: Sure, I'll give it a go!
You don't stand a chance against me!
Maybe next time, Garibaldi.

Fields.DialogueText: And the winner is... the capitano!
And the winner is... Crew Member Franklin!
Aww... really?
*ALARM*
We can have more fun later! Everyone, get to your stations!
I'm supposed to say that...
@BATTLE
Great match, Capitano!
We should do this again sometime, Capitano!
There is a Morgana fleet in proximity! We have to move!
@BATTLE
Give me a status report.
Not picking up any additional threats, Captain.
Nice work, crew.
Come on, Capitano! Raise his spirit! Inspire him!
O-oh... right.

Fields.MenuText: Thank you for your dedication during these troubled times. You are all heroes in my eyes.
One step closer to victory! Keep this up!
Garibaldi and I support you all one hundred percent!

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Captain! I speak for all of us when I say you are a great leader!
We will do our best, Captain!
Thank you both! We couldn't do this without you!
With that said, let's take this moment in stride. We won another fight!
(whispers) Nice job, Capitano! That was perfect.
A moment, Capitano?
Sure, what's on your mind?
Well, we've been doing great in all of our recent battles, so I thought I'd thank you with a gift! I just a little thing I carved, but I thought you might like it.

Fields.MenuText: Thank you, Garibaldi. I'll treasure it.
It's thanks to you that we've been doing so well!
I didn't get you anything...

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad you like it!
Now, Capitano! Don't make me blush!
That isn't necessary, Capitano! I insist, take it!
Now, if you'll excuse me. It took me a while to make that, and I still have more members of the crew to thank...
You're really quite the Belle, Garibaldi.
Aww, you flatter me, Capitano!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Knock, knock, Capitano! Fancy sharing another snack with me?
Sure, come on in.
Capitano, what do you want to do after the war is over?

Fields.MenuText: I'd like to go home... maybe find a place to settle down...
I'd like to explore the world, and really see what it has to offer.
I'm not sure...

Fields.DialogueText: That sounds nice, going home... and getting plenty of sleep...
You certainly do seem to be the adventurous type!
No? Maybe it's time you start thinking about it. This war won't last forever, after all...
What about you?
If I were able to leave this ship, I would want to get some land and sunbathe for the rest of my life. Without a care in the world...
That sounds like a good plan.
Even if we defeat the Morganas, though, I'm not convinced peace will return to the world. So much hostility still exists between nations.
Who knows, maybe...
*ALARM*
Maybe later.
@BATTLE
Capitano, wanna see a trick?

Fields.MenuText: It depends. What kind of trick is it?
I don't know, you planning on embarrassing me?
Sure, I could use a good laugh.

Fields.DialogueText: You may have already seen it, but...
Depends on what you find embarrassing!
Then watch this!
Ah, the old orange wedge in the mouth trick.
Mmmphhhh... What do you think?
Garibaldi... people are staring...
Really?! Maybe they can join in!
And, everyone else in the mess is following suit. Why am I not surprised?
Hello, Captain!
Yay!
Yes, yes, hello everyone. Yes, your collective orange smiles really are something else.
@BATTLE
I don't know... do you trust her?
She seems fine... she's been doing a great job at keeping morale high.
Can we really depend on her type?
What are you getting at?
I'm just saying that Italy cares about Italy, so who knows where her loyalties lie...
C-Captain! Hello, Captain!

Fields.MenuText: Wanna repeat that?
I think you owe Garibaldi an apology...
I'm going to pretend I didn't hear any of that. Get to the bridge. Now.

Fields.DialogueText: N-no, C-Captain. I-I mean... I'll get to the bridge!
Garibaldi, Ma'am! Please accept my apology! I'm very sorry!
Y-yes, Captain!
I guess it's time I give the non-Italian crewmembers another "We're all in this together or you're cleaning the heads alone" speech.
It's quite all right. We have more pressing matters to attend to.
Morganas?
What else?
@BATTLE
*sigh* Dismissed.
All is forgiven. Rest assured, I'm more on your side than you know.
What do we have going on here? Let's listen.
Aye, Captain.
That means you, too.
Captain, we have spotted multiple civilian vessels currently en route to an enemy Morgana fleet. What do you advise?
Capitano, If I may be so bold...
Go on, Garibaldi.
While I know that defeating a fleet this size would be a crippling blow for the Morganas, our priority should be to save as many civilians as possible.
With all due respect, ma'am, these civilian vessels should have been more aware of their surroundings. Dealing with the Morganas should be our top priority.
Capitano, if we lose the support of the people... then we lose the war.
That is not your decision, ma'am.
I know. Capitano, whatever choice you make, I'll support it.

Fields.MenuText: Our first priority is to serve civilians. But if that means defeating Morganas in the process, then we'll do what we must.
Dealing with the Morganas directly is our best option. Of course, we'll do our best to look out for the civilian ship while we do.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Capitano! Let's hurry!
I understand...
@BATTLE
Garibaldi? What's on your mind?
Capitano, I know you frequently have to make tough decisions when dealing with the Morganas.
I'd like to apologize if I add any unwanted pressure.

Fields.MenuText: I understand. When innocent lives are at stake, it's natural to get riled up.
I accept your apology. Please understand that you can't save everyone. Death is common in war.
In the future, I'd prefer you not question my decisions.

Fields.DialogueText: I agree. I hate watching people suffer.
Sorry. I can get caught up in tense moments, but I'll do my best to stop myself.
Garibaldi... are you still upset about the crew member passing away?
I know it's ridiculous... but I keep thinking about it.
You do understand that it wasn't your fault, right?
I know, Capitano. It's just, I wasn't ever able to thank him properly for his service.
I'm sure he knew how appreciative you were. And remember, you have a ship load of other crew members to look after.
I'll try.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Captain?
Captain, may I have a moment?
You may, but we have to deal with those Morganas first!
@BATTLE
Capitano! Just ignore me, I'm working on a trinket for one of the crew.
Of course you are.
Of course I am!
Now, sailor, sit. Tell me what's going on.
Well, I received a letter from my gal back home...
... And she said that all this time apart, well... she doesn't know whether our relationship is strong enough to weather all this.
Well, you could...
Capitano! Let me handle this one!

Fields.MenuText: He's all yours, Garibaldi.
What do you know about love?
Do you doubt my knowledge of romance?

Fields.DialogueText: Great! First, tell me everything about her!
I'm from Italy! One of the most romantic places in the world! Of course I know a thing or two about romance!
I'm sure you are quite the romantic, but let me handle this one.
Oh, all right... and thanks a lot, ma'am.
If you say so.
Fair enough.
So, Garibaldi, how did your talk with our lovesick sailor go?
It went well. I told him to reassure her...
All right...
That, and I crafted a wooden flower for him to send back home to her. She just needs to know that he still cares, and that their love is stronger than any war.

Fields.MenuText: Well, that's as good or better than anything I would have come up with.

Fields.DialogueText: What can I say? Italy taught me well!
You'll ha--
*ALARM*
Back to it?
Of course!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Dramatic gestures. Nice.
Maybe she's got somebody else already.

Fields.DialogueText: My specialty!
Then he needs a lot to win her back!
I keep wondering... do we really have what it takes to win?
Of course we have what it takes. What brought this up?
The Morganas. No matter how many times we push them into the ground, they get back up. It's like with every victory... Oh, hello, Captain!

Fields.MenuText: What's going on?
Garibaldi, what's the problem?
I can't afford to have my crew afraid. Toughen up!

Fields.DialogueText: This sailor here is feeling somewhat discouraged...
Our friend here needs some encouragement.
That might not be the best thing to say in this situation, Capitano...
It's true, the Morganas are relentless, but that doesn't make them invincible.
Everything has a weakness.
That's right, and we just haven't found it yet. The battles we're fighting now might not have any clear victor.
This war is one of attrition. We may not be able to recover as fast from a loss as them, but we can hold fast and endure! We can hold the line until we have the answer.
I think I understand... Thank you, Captain!
My pleasure, dismissed.
You're beginning to sound like me, Capitano!
@BATTLE
You know, once this war is over, I think I'm gonna miss this coffee. It's grown on me.
Really? I could go for an Italian brew right about now...
Captain, ma'am.
Hello, Officer! Care to join us?
I'd love to, but I have a pressing matter I'd wish to discuss with the captain. In private.

Fields.MenuText: Is the issue really that pressing? If it is, Garibaldi should hear it as well.
Garibaldi isn't much for waiting outside. She can stay.
You look a bit tired, Officer. Take a seat and I'll pour you a cup of coffee. I insist.

Fields.DialogueText: It is, Captain. I suppose I can deliver the news in front of Garibaldi, in that case.
I didn't mean any ill will towards her, Captain. It's just... I want to be careful about how many people hear this.
I guess I could use a drink... thank you, Captain.
So, what's the issue?
Morale.
Morale?
Yes, Captain. Recently these Morgana encounters have been extra taxing on our crew.
We need a course of action to solve this problem as quickly as possible. If we don't, I fear that our performance will suffer in battle.
Thank you for bringing this to our attention. You're dismissed.
Have anything in mind?
I can't think of anything at the moment. I'm sure we'll find a solution soon enough.
@BATTLE
*sigh*
... Stop fidgeting. If you want to talk, I'm happy to drop the paperwork for a bit.
Have you heard anything yet?

Fields.MenuText: Heard what?
About crew morale?
Only bits and pieces.

Fields.DialogueText: You know... about our crew losing morale... I figured you would have overheard something by now.
Yes! Anything?
Same here...
What do you think...
Shh!
It's just that, I feel that we're getting nowhere...
Really?
Haven't you noticed? The Morganas haven't slowed down one bit... they just keep coming back.
Now that I think about it... the attacks are becoming more frequent...
See? At this rate, continuing on like this would be suicide. I'm young, I still have my whole life to think of... I don't wanna waste it fighting an invincible enemy!
(whispers) Capitano. We have to act, and fast.
Let's meet later in my quarters. I'm sure we can solve this together.
@BATTLE
A few grumbles here and there, I think.
Capitano.
Garibaldi.
I've been thinking, what makes a good leader?

Fields.MenuText: Their determination. A focused leader never loses sight of their goals.
Compassion. A leader who cares about their soldiers can unify them all in one purpose.
Strength. Someone who can win every single battle flawlessly.

Fields.DialogueText: A focused leader is important. He could inspire others to stay the course, no matter what happens.
I agree! Caring about one another builds bonds that cannot be broken. Compassion boosts will and endurance.
While I think strength is important, I don't think it makes a great leader.
Why bring this up?
My mind has been at constant work, trying to work out a solution to improve the crew's morale. I haven't slept in... a while.
Have you thought of something?
I think so. I just needed to hear your opinion on leaders. I believe I have a solution... We can go over my plan once I get some sleep...
@BATTLE
That's it!
That's what?
The solution to our crew problem.
What do you have in mind?
I was thinking about something that could address everyone. So I think a speech from our great capitano is what we need!

Fields.MenuText: A speech? Are you sure?
Great idea, the only thing is... I'm not the best at delivering speeches...
Do I have to write it? I'm not much of a writer...

Fields.DialogueText: Yes! I think it's the only way to inspire the crew in one go.
Don't worry about that! We can practice ahead of time.
Just write from the heart. I know you care for you crew... You just need to put those feelings into prose.
Well, I guess I better get to work. I know the sooner I'm able to deliver the speech, the better.
If it takes too long, I...
*ALARM*
You know what that means...
To the bridge!
@BATTLE
I brought coffee.
I'm in your debt.
How's the speech coming along?

Fields.MenuText: It's... coming along...
Just... about... done...
Uh...

Fields.DialogueText: Can I see it?
Excellent! I'll get the crew to meet in the cafeteria!
You haven't written a single thing, have you?
It's not that, it's just...
Capitano. If you needed help, you should've asked.
Sorry, I guess I'm just feeling the pressure. I know how important this speech will be for the crew's well-being.
Nothing to fear. We'll work together. Let me sit here and help you.
That sounds good! Let's get to work!
*ALARM*
After this...
@BATTLE
U-Uh... hold on...
You have all been asked to come here today to listen to Garibaldi and the captain deliver an important message. Now, take it away, ma'am.
Hello! It's come to my attention that morale aboard this ship has taken a hit over the course of these last few battles.
Many of you have been expressing doubt over our situation. That we're in a losing war.
This type of thinking is what the enemy wants. They want you to believe our defeat is imminent.  But that is not the case.
Just because the enemy shows no weakness, does not make it invincible! If we allow fear to control our minds, then we'll never win.
We have to fight back! For our nations! For the good of the world!

Fields.MenuText: If we want any chance of winning, we have to remember... the fate of the world is in our hands. Use that as a goal to ease your worries. Fight for that dream!
We all need to stand together. Our strength and compassion will keep us alive. We need to endure.
There are always moments like these in times of doubt. But we must remain strong. We can overpower the Morganas!

Fields.DialogueText: *cheers*
Yes, Captain!
*cheers*
Now let's get out there and win this war!
Yes, Captain!
Dismissed!
@BATTLE
*cheers*
Can do!
Captain. I have good news!
What is it?
That speech you and Garibaldi delivered really riled up our crew. I've never seen them work so hard in maintaining the ship!
Hear that, Garibaldi?
I did! That's incredible! We must celebrate!
They've also really come to appreciate you, ma'am. They won't stop talking about how much you inspire them!

Fields.MenuText: It's all because of you, Garibaldi. You make this crew better.
That doesn't surprise me. Garibaldi has always been doing her best to keep our spirits high!
Did... they mention anything about me?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm honored by your words, Capitano!
Capitano! You're making me blush!
I'm sure they haven't stopped talking about you, Capitano!
I think the Morganas are going to have something to fear now...
@BATTLE
Garibaldi, a moment?
Sure thing, Capitano!
I wanted to thank you again for the speech, you really helped out!
Anything to help out the crew!
You know I've been thinking about what to do when this is all over.
Oh, yes?
And all the praise you have for your hometown hasn't left my thoughts.
It really is one of the best places in the world.

Fields.MenuText: I think when this war is over, I'll take you to that cafe. What do you think?
You'll have to show me around the city when this is all over.

Fields.DialogueText: That would be wonderful, Capitano.
I would be honored to do so, Capitano.
